query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Già era in loco onde s’udia ’l rimbombo 2 de l’acqua che cadea ne l’altro giro, 3 simile a quel che l’arnie fanno rombo,
query.result: 1 Already I was in a place where I could hear the echoing 2 of the water falling into the next circle, 3 similar to the buzzing sound that beehives make,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 quando tre ombre insieme si partiro, 5 correndo, d’una torma che passava 6 sotto la pioggia de l’aspro martiro.
query.result: 4 when three shades separated themselves from a group 5 that was passing by, running 6 under the rain of harsh martyrdom.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Venian ver’ noi, e ciascuna gridava: 8 «Sòstati tu ch’a l’abito ne sembri 9 esser alcun di nostra terra prava».
query.result: 7 They were coming towards us, and each one was crying out: 8 "Stop, you who by your clothing seem to us 9 to be someone from our wicked land".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Ahimè, che piaghe vidi ne’ lor membri, 11 ricenti e vecchie, da le fiamme incese! 12 Ancor men duol pur ch’i’ me ne rimembri.
query.result: 10 Alas, what wounds I saw on their limbs, 11 recent and old, burnt by the flames! 12 I still grieve just to remember them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 A le lor grida il mio dottor s’attese; 14 volse ’l viso ver’ me, e «Or aspetta», 15 disse, «a costor si vuole esser cortese.

Please translate each line literally into English.
16 E se non fosse il foco che saetta 17 la natura del loco, i’ dicerei 18 che meglio stesse a te che a lor la fretta».
query.result: 16 And if it were not for the fire that shoots out 17 from the nature of the place, I would say 18 that haste would suit you better than them".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Ricominciar, come noi restammo, ei 20 l’antico verso; e quando a noi fuor giunti, 21 fenno una rota di sé tutti e trei.
query.result: 19 They began again, as soon as we stopped, their 20 old refrain; and when they reached us, 21 they formed a circle with themselves, all three of them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Qual sogliono i campion far nudi e unti, 23 avvisando lor presa e lor vantaggio, 24 prima che sien tra lor battuti e punti,
query.result: 22 As naked and oiled wrestlers are accustomed to do, 23 watching for their hold and their advantage, 24 before they are locked together and grappling,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 così rotando, ciascuno il visaggio 26 drizzava a me, sì che ’n contraro il collo 27 faceva ai piè continüo vïaggio.
query.result: 25 so, wheeling around, each of them turned his face 26 towards me, so that his neck made a continual journey 27 in the opposite direction to his feet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 E «Se miseria d’esto loco sollo 29 rende in dispetto noi e nostri prieghi», 30 cominciò l’uno, «e ’l tinto aspetto e brollo,
query.result: 28 And "If the misery of this gloomy place 29 makes us and our prayers contemptible to you", 30 began one of them, "and our scorched and naked appearance,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 la fama nostra il tuo animo pieghi 32 a dirne chi tu se’, che i vivi piedi 33 così sicuro per lo ’nferno freghi.
query.result: 31 may our fame incline your mind 32 to tell us who you are, that you tread through Hell 33 with living feet so confidently.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Questi, l’orme di cui pestar mi vedi, 35 tutto che nudo e dipelato vada, 36 fu di grado maggior che tu non credi:
query.result: 34 This man, whose footprints you see me treading on, 35 although he goes naked and hairless, 36 was of higher rank than you think:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 nepote fu de la buona Gualdrada; 38 Guido Guerra ebbe nome, e in sua vita 39 fece col senno assai e con la spada.

Please translate each line literally into English.
40 L’altro, ch’appresso me la rena trita, 41 è Tegghiaio Aldobrandi, la cui voce 42 nel mondo sù dovria esser gradita.
query.result: 40 The other one, who treads the sand beside me, 41 is Tegghiaio Aldobrandi, whose voice 42 should be held in esteem in the world above.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 E io, che posto son con loro in croce, 44 Iacopo Rusticucci fui, e certo 45 la fiera moglie più ch’altro mi nuoce».
query.result: 43 And I, who am placed on the cross with them, 44 was Iacopo Rusticucci, and certainly 45 my shrewish wife harms me more than anything else".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 S’i’ fossi stato dal foco coperto, 47 gittato mi sarei tra lor di sotto, 48 e credo che ’l dottor l’avria sofferto;

49 ma perch’ io mi sarei brusciato e cotto, 50 vinse paura la mia buona voglia 51 che di loro abbracciar mi facea ghiotto.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 52 Then I began: "It was not disdain, but sorrow 53 for your condition that fixed itself within me, 54 so much so that it will take a long time to be completely dispelled,

Please translate each line literally into English.
55 tosto che questo mio segnor mi disse 56 parole per le quali i’ mi pensai 57 che qual voi siete, tal gente venisse.
query.result: 55 as soon as my lord spoke to me 56 words that made me think 57 that people like you were coming.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Di vostra terra sono, e sempre mai 59 l’ovra di voi e li onorati nomi 60 con affezion ritrassi e ascoltai.
query.result: 58 I am from your land, and I have always 59 recounted and listened to your deeds and your honored names 60 with affection.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

64 «Se lungamente l’anima conduca 65 le membra tue», rispuose quelli ancora, 66 «e se la fama tua dopo te luca,
query.result: 64 "If the soul leads your limbs for a long time," 65 he answered again, 66 "and if your fame shines after you,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 cortesia e valor dì se dimora 68 ne la nostra città sì come suole, 69 o se del tutto se n’è gita fora;

70 ché Guiglielmo Borsiere, il qual si duole 71 con noi per poco e va là coi compagni, 72 assai ne cruccia con le sue parole».
query.result: 70 For Guiglielmo Borsiere, who grieves 71 with us for a short while and goes there with his companions, 72 greatly torments us with his words».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 «La gente nuova e i sùbiti guadagni 74 orgoglio e dismisura han generata, 75 Fiorenza, in te, sì che tu già ten piagni».
query.result: 73 "The new people and the sudden gains 74 have generated pride and excess, 75 Florence, in you, so that you already lament it".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Così gridai con la faccia levata; 77 e i tre, che ciò inteser per risposta, 78 guardar l’un l’altro com’ al ver si guata.

query.result: 79 "If it costs you so little to satisfy others", 80 they all replied, "the other times, 81 happy are you if you speak so at your leisure!

Please translate each line literally into English.
88 Un amen non saria possuto dirsi 89 tosto così com’ e’ fuoro spariti; 90 per ch’al maestro parve di partirsi.

query.result: 103 so, down from a steep bank, 104 we found that dark water resounding, 105 so that in a short time it would have offended the ear.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Io avea una corda intorno cinta, 107 e con essa pensai alcuna volta 108 prender la lonza a la pelle dipinta.
query.result: 106 I had a cord tied around me, 107 and with it I had thought at one time 108 to catch the leopard with the spotted skin.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 109 After I had untied it all from myself, 110 just as my guide had commanded me, 111 I handed it to him, knotted and coiled.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 115 ‘Surely something new must correspond’, 116 I said to myself, ‘to the new signal 117 that my master follows so intently with his eyes’.
